meanings.definition: The occurrence of the same letter or sound at the beginning of adjacent or closely connected words.
meanings.sent1: Alliterations can make a sentence sound silly.
meanings.sent2: Poets often use alliterations to create a musical effect in their poems.
meanings.sent3: The tongue twister was full of tricky alliterations.
meanings.sent4: Her speech was like a beautiful dance of alliterations.
meanings.sent5: The alliterations in the song made it catchy and fun to sing along.

meanings.definition: The repetition of consonant sounds, especially at the beginning of words.
meanings.sent1: Alliterations can add a playful touch to writing.
meanings.sent2: The author's clever use of alliterations enhanced the rhythm of the story.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's joke was a clever mix of alliterations and humor.
meanings.sent4: The alliterations in the poem painted a vivid picture in my mind.
meanings.sent5: The alliterations in the advertisement made the product name memorable.
